basic.floral_language:
Echeveria purpusorum cv
Floriography: joyful, unity, cute
Echeveria purpusorum cv is a hybrid, has many small hypertrophy leaves with tips and light green color and reddish-brown markings, leaves arranged in compact rosette, when sunny, leaf back and edge turn red, like a blossoming lotus.
Echeveria purpusorum cv likes sunny places, dormant in winter under low temperature. May bloom on a long stem among leaves with orange bell-shaped flowers.
basic.blooming: Succulent plants, sometimes flowers, orange red flowers
basic.color: Leaf color pale green, with red brown marks, with adequate light leaf edges and lower surface turn to red

maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio
maintenance.sunlight: Like sunshine, resistant to half shade, in a state of dormancy under low temperature in winter
maintenance.watering: Do not water frequently, keep a dry environment, water every 7-10 days, water less frequently in winter dormancy
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply once monthly in spring and summer
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and rotten part timely
